availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Carlyle Nuckols. Father of George Nuckols, Claiborne Nuckols, Robert Nuckols, John Nuckols, and Louisa Nuckols. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned twenty-five enslaved people in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District No. 2, p. 466B. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District No. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Unnamed District, p. 38. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Unnamed District, pp. 16-7. William E. Railey, History of Woodford County, Kentucky (Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co., 2002), 108.
